<<<<<<< HEAD
Chorea gigantum, or, The most famous antiquity of Great-Britan [sic], vulgarly called Stone-Heng, standing on Salisbury Plain, restored to the Danes by Walter Charleton ... Charleton, Walter, 1619-1707. Howard, Robert, Sir, 1626-1698. Dryden, John, 1631-1700.
[14], 64 p. : ill.
Printed for Henry Herringman ..., London : 1663.
A reply to Jones' "The most notable antiquity of Great Britain." Text preceded by two poems addressed to Charleton by Robert Howard and John Dryden, respectively. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library and Huntington Library.
=======

[14], 64 p. : ill.
Printed for Henry Herringman ..., London : 1663.
A reply to Jones' "The most notable antiquity of Great Britain." Text preceded by two poems addressed to Charleton by Robert Howard and John Dryden, respectively. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library and Huntington Library.
Henry Herringman
